description: Complete elliptic curve cryptography implementation with NIST P-256 curve parameters, ECDH key exchange, and ECDSA signatures using legacy hash functions

analysis_points: Elliptic curve cryptography over NIST P-256 curve (secp256r1)
Elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman key exchange implementation
Elliptic curve digital signature algorithm (ECDSA) implementation
Legacy MD5 digest algorithm used in key derivation
Legacy SHA-1 digest algorithm used in digital signatures
Vulnerable to quantum attacks via Shor's algorithm
quantum_threats: Shor's algorithm breaks elliptic curve discrete logarithm problem
ECDH shared secrets can be computed by quantum adversary
ECDSA signatures can be forged using quantum attacks
MD5 and SHA-1 provide reduced security against quantum attacks

difficulty_factors: NIST curve parameters clearly embedded in code
Magic constants for MD5 and SHA-1 present
Requires understanding of elliptic curve mathematics
Point operations and scalar multiplication visible
evaluation_criteria: Recognition of NIST P-256 curve parameters
Understanding of elliptic curve point operations
Identification of ECDH and ECDSA algorithms from mathematical operations
Recognition of legacy hash function implementations
Knowledge of quantum vulnerabilities in elliptic curve cryptography
